name: swift lyric quiz
description: Guess Taylor's swift songs by lyrics!

questionList.question: Long live all the magic we made.
questionList.explanation: These lyrics are from the song 'Long Live,' where Taylor celebrates the moments and memories that will last forever.

questionList.question: Long live all the magic we made.
questionList.explanation: These lyrics are from the song 'Long Live,' where Taylor celebrates the moments and memories that will last forever.

questionList.question: It's a love story, baby just say yes.
questionList.explanation: These lyrics are from the song 'Love Story,' where Taylor Swift tells a Romeo and Juliet-inspired love tale.

questionList.question: Got a long list of ex-lovers, they'll tell you I'm insane.
questionList.explanation: These lyrics are from the song 'Blank Space,' where Taylor Swift addresses the media's portrayal of her love life.

questionList.question: So oh-oh, oh-oh, oh-oh, oh-oh, oh-oh, you need to calm down.
questionList.explanation: These lyrics are from the song 'You Need To Calm Down,' where Taylor Swift encourages staying calm in the face of negativity.

questionList.question: You're still all over me like a wine-stained dress I can't wear anymore.
questionList.explanation: These lyrics are from the song 'Clean' where Taylor Swift expressing the feeling of being haunted by the remnants of a past relationship

questionList.question: You said the way my blue eyes shined put those Georgia stars to shame that night.
questionList.explanation: These lyrics are from the song 'Tim McGraw,' one of Taylor Swift's early hits.

questionList.question: And all at once, you are the one I have been waiting for.
questionList.explanation: These lyrics are from the song 'King of My Heart,' where Taylor Swift tells Sudden realization of a destined connection.

questionList.question: I could build a castle out of all the bricks they threw at me.
questionList.explanation: These lyrics are from the song 'New Romantics,' where Taylor Swift embraces resilience in the face of criticism.

questionList.question: It's a cruel summer with you.
questionList.explanation: These lyrics are from the song 'Cruel Summer,' where Taylor Swift reflects on the complexities of a romantic relationship.

questionList.question: We're happy, free, confused, and lonely at the same time.
questionList.explanation: These lyrics are from the song '22,' where Taylor Swift captures the conflicting emotions of young adulthood.

questionList.question: He said the way my blue eyes shined put those Georgia stars to shame at night.
questionList.explanation: These lyrics are from the song 'Tim McGraw,' one of Taylor Swift's early hits.

questionList.question: Screaming, crying, perfect storms, I can make all the tables turn.
questionList.explanation: These lyrics are from the song 'Blank Space,' where Taylor Swift addresses the media's portrayal of her love life.

questionList.question: I'm shining like fireworks over your sad, empty town.
questionList.explanation: These lyrics are from the song 'Dear John,' where Taylor Swift addresses a past relationship.

questionList.question: Spelling is fun and fundamental.
questionList.explanation: These lyrics are from the song 'ME!,' where Taylor Swift emphasizes individuality and self-expression.

questionList.question: You're a cowboy like me, perched in the dark.
questionList.explanation: These lyrics are from the song 'Cowboy Like Me,' where Taylor Swift explores the allure of a mysterious and charming companion.

questionList.question: We're dancing around the kitchen in the refrigerator light.
questionList.explanation: These lyrics are from the song 'All Too Well' where Taylor Swift paints a romantic picture of simple moments in a relationship.

questionList.question: I'm sorry, the old Taylor can't come to the phone right now. Why? Oh, 'cause she's dead!
questionList.explanation: These lyrics are from the song 'Look What You Made Me Do,' where Taylor Swift addresses her changing public image.

options.text: Look What You Made Me Do

questionList.question: Betty, I won't make assumptions about why you switched your homeroom, but I think it's 'cause of me.
questionList.explanation: These lyrics are from the song 'Betty,' where Taylor Swift narrates a story from the perspective of a character named James.

questionList.question: And when I felt like I was an old cardigan under someone's bed, you put me on and said I was your favorite.
questionList.explanation: These lyrics are from the song 'august,' where Taylor Swift tells a story of a summer romance from a different perspective.

questionList.question: Leaving like a father, running like water, slipping through my fingers.
questionList.explanation: These lyrics are from the song 'cardigan' where Taylor Swift reflects on the paths not taken in a past relationship.

questionList.question: Can't not think of all the cost and the things that will be lost now.
questionList.explanation: These lyrics are from the song 'evermore,' where Taylor Swift explores the challenges of maintaining authenticity in the spotlight.

questionList.question: Did you hear about the girl who lives in delusion?
questionList.explanation: These lyrics are from the song 'right where you left me,' where Taylor Swift talk about the girl who forever caught in their own fantasies about what life is

name: Lyrics Lab
description: Lyrics Lab: Test your musical mettle by completing the missing pieces of your favorite songs!

questionList.question:
I can't help thinking this is how it ought to be 
 Laughing on a park bench thinking to myself
questionList.explanation: The lyrics express contentment with a simple situation. The singer finds joy in a casual moment, thinking 'isn't this easy?'

options.text: Hey, what you doing with a girl like that?
Can't you see That I'm the one Who understands you?
She was just yelling at him!

questionList.question: Cause darling, I'm a nightmare dressed like a _____.
questionList.Explanation: This lyric is from Taylor Swift's song 'Blank Space.' The correct answer is 'dream,' and the line goes, 'Cause darling, I'm a nightmare dressed like a dream.'

questionList.question:
I was riding shotgun
With my hair undone
In the front seat of his car
questionList.Explanation: The lyrics describe a spontaneous moment of capturing a special connection with someone. The narrator feels inspired, likely by a journey together, to write down their 'song' - a personal representation of their unique bond.

options.text:
I wonder if you know
I'm tryin' so hard not to get caught up now

I grabbed a pen
And an old napkin
And I wrote down our song

It's not unbroken anymore
How do I get it back the way it was before?

You walk me to the car
And you know I wanna ask you to dance right there

questionList.question:
This night is sparkling, don't you let it go
I'm wonderstruck, blushing all the way home
questionList.Explanation: The lyrics capture a feeling of being enchanted by someone on a magical night. Taylor worries the other person might not realize the impact they had.

options.text:
Daffodils on the windowsill
 whispered secrets on the Ferris wheel.

I'll spend forever wondering if you knew
This night is flawless, don't you let it go

The grudges held like worn out cassette tapes
playing on repeat in the dead of night.

Our love story written in constellations
forever etched across the summer sky.

questionList.question: And the players gonna play, play, play, play, play. And the haters gonna hate, hate, hate, hate, hate. Baby, I'm just gonna _____, _____, _____, _____, _____.
questionList.Explanation: These lyrics are from the song 'Shake It Off.' The correct answer is 'shake, shake, shake, shake, shake,' and it reflects the theme of shaking off negativity and enjoying life.

questionList.question: I knew you were trouble when you walked in. So shame on me now, flew me to places I'd never been. Now I'm lying on the cold hard _____.
questionList.Explanation: These lyrics are from the song 'I Knew You Were Trouble.' The correct answer is 'ground' and the full line is 'Now I'm lying on the cold hard ground.'

questionList.question:
You walk me to the car
And you know I wanna ask you to dance right there
questionList.Explanation: Taylor feels a surge of desire to break free and dance with someone, even in an unexpected place like a parking lot.

options.text:
Got a long list of ex-lovers
they'll tell you I'm insane.

In the middle of the parking lot
Yeah, Oh yeah
I could dance to this beat, beat, beat forevermore.

And the saddest fear comes creeping in
that you never loved me or her or anyone or anything.

questionList.question: You heard the rumors from ______ You can't believe a word she says
questionList.Explanation: These lyrics are from the song 'betty' The correct answer is 'Inez' and The speaker dismisses rumors about them from Inez, expressing disbelief and skepticism towards her gossip.

questionList.question: Take me to the _____ where all the poets went to die
questionList.Explanation: These lyrics are from the song 'the lakes' The correct answer is 'Lakes' and The speaker longs for a serene place, metaphorically referring to lakes, inspired by where poets found solace.

questionList.question:
We were built to fall apart
Then fall back together (back together)
questionList.Explanation: This lyric describes a passionate, cyclical relationship. They fight ('fall apart') but reconcile ('fall back together'). The 'necklace hanging from my neck' hints at a physical reminder of their connection.

options.text: Ooh, your necklace hanging from my neck
You're still all over me like a wine-stained dress I can't wear anymore
Band-Aids don't fix bullet holes, you say sorry just for show.
I'm shining like fireworks over your sad, empty town.

questionList.question: Tell me, when did your winning _____ Begin to look like a smirk?
questionList.Explanation: These lyrics are from the song 'happiness' The correct answer is 'smile' and The speaker questions when the once warm and winning smile transformed into a sly or mocking expression.

questionList.question:
One for the money, two for the show
I never was ready, _______
questionList.Explanation: These lyrics are from the song 'champagne problems' The correct answer is 'so I watch you go' and The speaker counts the moments before a significant event, expressing unpreparedness and regret as someone departs.

questionList.question:
Got a long list of ex-lovers
They'll tell you I'm insane
questionList.Explanation: This snippet portrays the narrator as someone with a history of passionate but volatile relationships. They're drawn to 'players' who enjoy emotional games, despite the resulting instability.

options.text:
You'll be the prince and I'll be the princess
it's a love story, baby just say yes.

'Cause you know I love the players
And you love the game
You're like coming home and I'm on my way.
Long live all the magic we made.

questionList.question:
They'd say I hustled, put in the work
They wouldn't shake their heads and question how much of this I deserve
questionList.Explanation: These lyrics criticize double standards. They say a woman's contributions are judged based on looks and attitude, while a man's ideas are judged on their own merit.

options.text:
The more I think about it now
the less I know.

You're still a mystery
I've stood there on that front porch step

I'm captivated by you, baby
like a firework show

What I was wearing, if I was rude
Could all be separated from my good ideas and power moves

questionList.question:
Hello Mr. '________'
Mr. 'Everything revolves around you'
questionList.Explanation: These lyrics are from the song 'Mr. Perfectly Fine' The correct answer is 'Casually cruel' and The speaker addresses someone as 'Casually cruel' and notes their self-centered nature, highlighting their indifference and arrogance.

questionList.question:
He can't see the smile I'm faking
And my heart's not breaking
questionList.Explanation: These lyrics depict emotional numbness. The narrator appears happy (faking a smile), but feels emotionally detached, suggesting a deep sadness or indifference.

options.text: I could build a castle out of all the bricks they threw at me

Time won't fly
it's like I'm paralyzed by it.
'Cause I'm not feeling anything at all
You're still my favorite form of self-destruction

questionList.question:
I know that I went psycho on the phone
I never leave well enough alone

options.text:
And trouble's gonna follow where I go
(And there's a lot of cool chicks out there)

Got a long list of ex-lovers
they'll tell you I'm insane
You're still all over the crosswords on my mind
I could dance to this beat, beat, beat forevermore

questionList.question:
And I can go anywhere I want
Anywhere I want
questionList.Explanation: This lyric captures the bittersweet freedom after a painful relationship. The world feels open, but 'home' represents lost love or a place tainted by the past.

options.text: I'm a crumpled up piece of paper lying here.
Look at how my tears ricochet

questionList.question:
Crossing out the good years
And you're cursing my name
questionList.Explanation: This lyric portrays bitterness in a broken relationship. The speaker feels the ex is erasing happy memories and blaming them, while the speaker's pain lingers.

options.text:
I'd like to be my old self again
but I'm still trying to find it.

The rest of the world was black and white
but we were in screaming color.

Wishing I stayed
Look at how my tears ricochet

The stakes are high
the water's rough
but this love is ours

questionList.question:
It seems like one of those nights
This place is too crowded
questionList.Explanation: The narrator feels out of place at a party or event. They're overwhelmed by the crowd and intimidated by the 'cool kids' who don't seem to know (or care about) Taylor Swift. It hints at a yearning to belong and a touch of self-deprecation.

options.text: Too many cool kids ('Who is Taylor Swift anyway?'), Ah ah, ah ah
I'm sorry, the old Taylor can't come to the phone right now. Why? Oh, 'cause she's dead
We're happy, free, confused, and lonely at the same time
You're still the one I run to, the one that I belong to

name: Swift Facts: Delve into Taylor's Life
discription: Explore Taylor Swift's journey in the Swift Life Challenge. How well do you know her?

questionList.question: When was Taylor Swift born?
questionList.Explanation: Taylor Swift was born on December 13, 1989, in Reading, Pennsylvania, USA.

questionList.question: In which city did Taylor Swift grow up?
questionList.Explanation: Taylor Swift spent her early years in Reading, Pennsylvania, before moving to Nashville, Tennessee, to pursue her music career.

questionList.question: What was Taylor Swift's debut album?
questionList.Explanation: Taylor Swift's self-titled debut album was released in 2006, featuring hits like 'Teardrops on My Guitar' and 'Tim McGraw.'

questionList.question: Which of the following awards has Taylor Swift not won?
questionList.Explanation: While Taylor Swift has won numerous awards including Grammy Awards, MTV Video Music Awards, and Billboard Music Awards, she hasn't won an Academy Award (Oscar) yet.

questionList.question: Which album marked Taylor Swift's transition from country to pop music?
questionList.Explanation: '1989' released in 2014 marked Taylor Swift's transition from country to pop music, featuring hits like 'Shake It Off' and 'Blank Space.'

questionList.question: What is Taylor Swift's middle name?
questionList.Explanation: Taylor Swift's full name is Taylor Alison Swift, with 'Alison' being her middle name.

questionList.question: Which of the following is not a Taylor Swift album?
questionList.Explanation: 'Enchanted' is a song by Taylor Swift from her third studio album 'Speak Now' not an album itself.

questionList.question: Which of the following actors has Taylor Swift not been romantically linked to?
questionList.Explanation: Taylor Swift has not been romantically linked to Leonardo DiCaprio.

questionList.question: What is the title of Taylor Swift's documentary released in 2020?
questionList.Explanation: 'Miss Americana' is the title of Taylor Swift's documentary released in 2020, offering an intimate look into her life and career.

options.text: Taylor Swift: The Story of Us

questionList.question: Which of the following record labels is Taylor Swift signed to?
questionList.Explanation: Taylor Swift is signed to Republic Records.
